info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 2:51PM MDT until September 13 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Utah, including the following county, Grand.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 251 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Washes and drainages near Arches National Park and areas near Highway 313...are the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arches National Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
